definition: UNESCO, United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
pinyin: Lian2 he2 guo2 Jiao4 Ke1 Wen2 Zu3 zhi1

definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]
to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries

sentences.english: UNESCO’s online forum on Inclusive Education is open.
sentences.chinese: 聯合國教科文組織全納教育網上論壇開始了。

sentences.english: As a result, it has become a member of NESCO in 1996.
sentences.chinese: 1996年，學校成爲聯合國教科文組織俱樂部成員。

sentences.english: Ustinov later became a staunch6 advocate for UNESCO.
sentences.chinese: 烏斯季諾夫後來成爲聯合國教科文組織的堅定擁護者。

sentences.english: Until now, UNESCO has established more than 550 chairs.
sentences.chinese: 目前，聯合國教科文組織共設立了550多個教席。

sentences.english: Ann-Therese Ndong-Jatta is education director for UNESCO in Africa.
sentences.chinese: Jatta是聯合國教科文組織非洲辦事處教育主任。

sentences.english: The tradition of building human towers, however, interests UNESCO the most.
sentences.chinese: 然而，傳統的疊羅漢最引起聯合國教科文組織的關注。

sentences.english: Hwaseong was added to the UNESCO World Heritage list in 1997.
sentences.chinese: 華城在1997年被加入聯合國教科文組織世界遺產。

definition: to be chosen/to be elected as
